service_patterns.name: Service pattern
service_patterns.description: Common actions or user interactions used in the service to complete a task.

items.name: Start something
items.description: Allows the user to start something, for example, become a teacher.

items.name: Check eligibility
items.description: Allows the user to check their eligibility for something, for example, check their eligibility for a teacher training course.

items.name: Apply for something
items.description: Allows the user to apply for something, for example, apply for funds for their school.

items.name: Register
items.description: Allows the user to register for something, for example, register to use a product or service.

items.name: Sign in
items.description: Allows the user to sign in to something, for example, sign in using DfE Sign-in or GOV.UK One Login

items.name: Check your answers
items.description: Allows the user to check their answers, for example, check their answers before submitting a form.

items.name: Book something
items.description: Allows the user to book something, for example, book a place on a course or book a place on a training course.

items.name: Pay for something
items.description: Allows the user to pay for something, for example, pay for a course or pay for a training course.

items.name: Receive payment
items.description: Allows the user to receive payment, for example, receive a grant or funding.

items.name: Verify Identity
items.description: Allows the user to verify their identity, for example, verify their identity using GOV.UK One Login or provide a document to verify their identity.

items.name: Find something
items.description: Allows the user to find something, for example, find a training provider, school, or college.

items.name: Learn something
items.description: Allows the user to learn something, for example, Early years child development training.

items.name: Report something
items.description: Allows the user to report something, for example, report a problem with a service, misconduct, or child welfare concerns.

items.name: Manage something
items.description: Allows the user to manage something, for example, manage a record the user has access to.

items.name: Check something
items.description: Allows the user to check the status of something, check the details of something, or check the availability of something.

items.name: Upload something
items.description: Allows the user to upload a file, upload a document, or upload a photo.

items.name: Download something
items.description: Allows the user to download a file, download a document, or download a photo.

items.name: Appeal something
items.description: Allows the user to appeal a decision, appeal a penalty, or appeal a fine.

items.name: Give feedback
items.description: Allows the user to give feedback on something, give feedback on a service, or give feedback on a product.

items.name: Request something
items.description: Allows the user to request something, for example a document or a form.

items.name: End something
items.description: Services and products which end something, for example, end being a a teacher.

user_groups.name: User group
user_groups.description: Different types of users who interact with the service, defined by their roles or demographics.

items.name: Adult learner or adult career seeker (aged 19 or older)
Education provider and early years workforce

service_archetypes.name: Service archetype
service_archetypes.description: Classifications of services based on their purpose and functionality.

items.name: Transactional
items.description: Services where a government record is created, updated, or deleted.

items.name: Information
items.description: Services that provide information only, such as policy documents, guidance, or statistics.

items.name: Support or advisory
items.description: Services that provide support or advice, such as a helpline or forum.

items.name: Regulatory and compliance
items.description: Services that are required by law, such as a license or permit.

items.name: Data collection and reporting
items.description: Services that collect data or report on data, such as a survey or pupil census.

items.name: Internal service
items.description: Services that are used by staff within the organisation or across government and not available to the public.

items.name: API
items.description: Services that are accessed via an API and generally have no user interface.

items.name: Campaign website
items.description: Services that are used to run a campaign, are time limited, and designed to drive user engagement on a specific policy.

phases.name: Phase
phases.description: Stages of service development from initial exploration through to decommissioning.

items.name: Explore
items.description: Initial idea and building a business case.

items.name: Discovery
items.description: Understand the problem and the needs of the users.

items.name: Alpha
items.description: Service is in alpha, and being prototyped and tested with selected users.

items.name: Private Beta
items.description: Service is in private beta, only accessible to a limited group of users.

items.name: Public Beta
items.description: Service is in public beta, accessible to all users.

items.name: Live
items.description: Service is live, accessible to all users.

items.name: Decomissioning
items.description: Service is being decommissioned.

items.name: Decomissioned
items.description: Service is decommissioned, no longer accessible to users.

channels.name: Channel
channels.description: Different channels through which users can access the service.

life_stages.name: Life stage
life_stages.description: Key life stages outlining relevant age ranges and contexts for users.

items.name: Early childhood
items.detail: Involves early years support, childcare, and pre-school education.

items.name: School age
items.detail: Compulsory education phase where children attend primary and secondary schools.

items.name: Post-compulsory / adolescent
items.detail: Transition phase where young people either continue into further education or training; key decisions about career paths are made.

items.name: Young adult
items.detail: Transition into independence, higher education or workforce entry, and, for care leavers, ongoing support.

items.name: Adult
items.detail: Continuous upskilling and professional development, often via adult education, apprenticeships, and vocational training.

education_phases.name: Education phase
education_phases.description: Phases of the education system, covering key stages and learning pathways.

technology.name: Technology
technology.description: Technologies used in the course of providing the service.

items.name: Azure
items.description: Microsoft's cloud computing service for hosting and security.

items.name: GOV.UK Notify
items.description: Government's email and SMS service for sending notifications to users.

items.name: GOV.UK Pay
items.description: Government's payment service for accepting payments from users.

items.name: GOV.UK One Login
items.description: Government's identity verification service for verifying user identities and signing in to services.

items.name: DfE Sign-in
items.description: The DfE's authentication service for signing into sector-facing services.

items.name: DfE Identity
items.description: Authentication service for DfE services by teachers and other staff.

policy.name: Policy
policy.description: Policies and regulations that affect the service.

items.name: Teacher training and professional development
items.description: Funding and grants for training. Initial Teacher Training (ITT), Qualified Teacher Status (QTS), teacher subject specialism courses.
